Rouse Properties Inc.'s stock RSE, -0.85% soared 26% in premarket trade Tuesday, after the real estate investment trust said it received an unsolicited buyout bid from Brookfield Asset Management BAM, -1.07% for $17 a share.
Brookfield is Rouse's largest shareholder, owning about 19.4 million Rouse shares, or about 33% of the shares outstanding, according to FactSet.
With about 58.02 million shares outstanding, according to FactSet, the bid would value Rouse at $986.3 million.
Rouse's stock has tumbled 24% over the past three months through Friday, while the S&P 500 has lost 7.5%.
Rouse said it established a special committee to evaluate Brookfield's bid.
Brookfield's stock was indicated more than 2% higher ahead of the open.
The per-share bid was 26% above Friday's closing price of $13.49.
